channel.title: Who'd say? Webcams can indeed spy without turning on the light
channel.description:
As seen here:
http://www.washingtonpost.com/blogs/the-switch/wp/2013/12/18/research-shows-how-macbook-webcams-can-spy-on-their-users-without-warning/
And I thought this was hard wired and not possible to break without hardware access... Now I wonder how difficult it would be to just feed that led through camera energy activation alone.

item.title: Who'd say? Webcams can indeed spy without turning on the light
item.dc:creator: @cregox Caue Rego
item.description:
@cregox wrote:

As seen here:

www.washingtonpost.com

Research shows how MacBook Webcams can spy on their users without warning

Your laptop's Webcam has a light that's supposed to turn on any time the camera does. But research shows it's possible for hackers to disable the light.

And I thought this was hard wired and not possible to break without hardware access... Now I wonder how difficult it would be to just feed that led through camera energy activation alone.
